meanings.definition: Naffs (verb): to be uncool or unfashionable
meanings.sent1: She always naffs up her outfits with mismatched socks.
meanings.sent2: The old hat naffs her overall look.
meanings.sent3: His attempt at dancing was so naffs, it made everyone giggle.
meanings.sent4: The outdated slang naffs his speech, making him sound like a time traveler.
meanings.sent5: The neon fanny pack naffs her style, making her stand out in a bad way.

meanings.definition: Naffs (noun): something that is tacky or unappealing
meanings.sent1: The garden gnome is a real naffs in their otherwise elegant yard.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't stand the naffs of the cheap plastic jewelry.
meanings.sent3: The bright pink flamingo lawn ornament is a hilarious naffs in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: The naffs of the velvet Elvis painting in the living room is hard to ignore.
meanings.sent5: The tacky souvenir snow globe is the ultimate naffs on her desk.
